name.japanese: ホーディ・ジョーンズ

keyMoments.title: Hody Jones Overdoses on Energy Steroids
keyMoments.description: Suffering from intense pain caused by Zoro's wound, Hody Jones demands and consumes more Energy Steroids, triggering a dramatic transformation in his body.
keyMoments.significance: Critical moment that transforms Hody into his most powerful and dangerous form, while also demonstrating the horrific side effects of Energy Steroid abuse.

keyMoments.title: Hody's Monstrous Transformation
keyMoments.description: After overdosing on Energy Steroids, Hody transforms into a monstrous form - becoming far more muscular with bulging muscles and thick veins, dramatically increasing in size, and his dark hair bleaching completely white.
keyMoments.significance: Hody's transformation represents the peak of his physical power and the central visual threat of the Fish-Man Island conflict.

keyMoments.title: Hody Demonstrates His Enhanced Power
keyMoments.description: Hody displays his newfound strength by using a devastating water shot attack on Neptune's army, leveling the entire area and shocking everyone present.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of how dramatically Energy Steroids have amplified Hody's fish-man strength and water manipulation abilities.

abilities.description: After consuming Energy Steroids, Hody's water shot attacks become devastatingly powerful, capable of leveling entire areas.

reveals.information: Hody's Energy Steroid overdose transformation - white hair, massive muscles, dramatically increased power
Energy Steroids cause severe side effects including accelerated aging and physical deterioration

keyMoments.title: Neptune Explains Energy Steroids' Side Effects
keyMoments.description: King Neptune warns the Fish-Man Island citizens about the dangerous side effects of Energy Steroids, explaining that they cause accelerated aging and severe physical deterioration.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial world-building information about Energy Steroids and establishes the long-term consequences that will eventually leave Hody and his crew as frail, aged husks.
keyMoments.quote: The candle that burns twice as bright burns half as long.

reveals.information: Neptune knows about the dangerous side effects of Energy Steroids and their accelerated aging effect

keyMoments.title: The Neptune Princes Depart to Save Their Father
keyMoments.description: Fukaboshi leads his brothers Manboshi and Ryuboshi toward Gyoncorde Plaza to rescue their captured father, King Neptune.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the princes' loyalty and courage as they rush to save their father despite the overwhelming threat.

keyMoments.title: Fukaboshi Reconsiders His Opinion of the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: While traveling to the plaza, Fukaboshi comments that he thinks the Straw Hats are not bad people and may have been misjudged, with his brothers agreeing.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the growing respect the Neptune family has for the Straw Hat Pirates, recognizing they are not the criminals Hody portrayed them to be.
keyMoments.quote: I think the Straw Hats are not bad and may have been misjudged.

relationships.description: Fukaboshi reconsiders his initial mistrust and recognizes the Straw Hats may have been misjudged.

evolutionMoments.description: Fukaboshi comments that the Straw Hats are not bad and may have been misjudged.

reveals.information: Fukaboshi no longer sees the Straw Hats as criminals but as potential allies

keyMoments.title: Dosun Breaks Free After Taking Energy Steroids
keyMoments.description: Dosun, the hammerhead shark fish-man, consumes Energy Steroids and breaks free from his chains, beginning to rampage and destroy buildings with his massive hammer.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of how Energy Steroids enhance the already formidable strength of the New Fish-Man Pirates officers.

abilities.description: After consuming Energy Steroids, Dosun's already impressive strength is enhanced, allowing him to break free from chains and destroy buildings.

keyMoments.title: Daruma Chews Through the Candy Factory
keyMoments.description: Daruma, the cookiecutter shark fish-man, uses his powerful burrowing abilities and jaw strength to chew through the Candy Factory on Fish-Man Island.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Daruma's destructive eating abilities and his carnal urge to bite through structures.

abilities.description: Daruma can burrow through structures and has powerful jaws capable of chewing through solid buildings like the Candy Factory.

keyMoments.title: Hyouzou's Drunken Sword Rampage
keyMoments.description: Hyouzou, the strongest swordsman on Fish-Man Island, drunkenly wields his swords to terrorize the fishmen, displaying his alarming speed and deadly skill.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Hyouzou as a dangerous threat even while intoxicated, foreshadowing his eventual confrontation with Zoro.

abilities.description: Hyouzou wields multiple swords with alarming speed and deadly precision, even while intoxicated.

reveals.information: Hyouzou is the strongest swordsman on Fish-Man Island

keyMoments.title: Zeo Uses Camouflaging Technique
keyMoments.description: Zeo, the Japanese wobbegong fish-man, demonstrates his ability to camouflage himself, becoming completely invisible as he advances toward the plaza.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zeo's unique ability that makes him one of Hody's strongest lieutenants and a difficult opponent to combat.

abilities.description: Zeo can become completely invisible using his fish-man camouflaging abilities.

name.japanese: バンダー・デッケン九世

keyMoments.title: Vander Decken Decides to Kill Shirahoshi
keyMoments.description: On the Noah, Vander Decken IX shaves off his head and makes the decision to kill Princess Shirahoshi, escalating his obsessive pursuit.
keyMoments.significance: Marks a turning point in Vander Decken's pursuit of Shirahoshi, from obsessive love to murderous intent.

relationships.description: Vander Decken's obsession with Shirahoshi turns from twisted love to murderous intent.

evolutionMoments.description: Vander Decken decides to kill Shirahoshi instead of pursuing her romantically.

reveals.information: Vander Decken decides to kill Shirahoshi, shifting from obsessive love to murderous intent
